messages.text: hey are we still doing that hiking thing next month?
Yeah! The cabin is booked for the 15th through 17th
sweet, should I bring my tent just in case?
probably a good idea, remember last time when it rained all night and the roof leaked?
lol don't remind me, my sleeping bag was soaked
I'll bring extra tarps this time
good thinking. also we should figure out food
I can handle breakfasts - pancakes and eggs?
perfect, I'll do dinners. thinking burgers first night, pasta second
sounds great! I'll bring snacks and drinks
hey did you ever read that book I recommended?
which one? you recommend like 10 books a month lol
haha fair. The one about AI and consciousness - Klara and the Sun
oh right! I actually finished it last week
and?? what did you think?
Really loved it. The way it explores what it means to be human through an AI's perspective was fascinating
Though the ending made me kinda sad
I know right? Ishiguro really knows how to write melancholy
Any other recommendations? I'm in a reading mood
Try Project Hail Mary by Andy Weir if you want something more upbeat. It's about an astronaut who wakes up alone on a spaceship with no memory
ooh that sounds good, adding to my list
okay I finally perfected my grandmother's cheesecake recipe
THE cheesecake?? The one you've been trying to recreate for years?
YES. turns out the secret was room temperature cream cheese AND a water bath
please share the recipe I'm begging
okay so: 4 packages cream cheese (room temp!!), 1 cup sugar, 1 tsp vanilla, 4 eggs, 1 cup sour cream
beat cream cheese until smooth, add sugar gradually, then vanilla. Add eggs one at a time. Fold in sour cream last
bake at 325F in a water bath for about 55 minutes. Turn off oven, crack door, let it cool inside for an hour
saving this forever, thank you!!
what about the crust?
graham cracker crust - 1.5 cups crushed crackers, 1/3 cup sugar, 6 tbsp melted butter. Press into pan, bake 10 min at 325
you're a legend
ugh the deployment failed again
same error as yesterday?
no this time it's a memory issue. The container keeps getting OOM killed
did you check if someone changed the resource limits?
good call... checking now
yep someone set memory limit to 256MB instead of 2GB
lmao how does that even happen
probably a typo in the yaml. We really need to set up proper code review for infra changes
agreed. fixing it now, should be back up in 5
nice, let us know when it's green
deployed and healthy!
great work. I'll open a ticket about the review process
happy birthday!!!
thank you!! can't believe I'm 30 now
welcome to the club lol. any big plans?
dinner with family tonight, then we're doing the big party on Saturday
right the rooftop thing! I'm so excited
me too, the weather is supposed to be perfect
do you need me to bring anything?
just yourself! but if you want to bring that amazing guacamole you make, no one would complain
say no more, guac it is
what are we watching tonight?
I vote for Dune Part 2
ooh yes I still haven't seen it
same! I loved the first one
wait have none of you seen it?? it's incredible
I've seen it twice already but I'll happily watch again
no spoilers!
I'll just say the cinematography is even better than the first one
what time should we start? I can order pizza
7pm? gives us time to eat before the movie
works for me
same
cool, I'll get a couple large pepperoni and one veggie
hey quick question - what was that app you use for tracking expenses?
YNAB - You Need A Budget
is it worth the subscription?
honestly yes. I was skeptical at first but it completely changed how I think about money
the main idea is you give every dollar a job before you spend it
interesting. I've just been using spreadsheets but it's getting messy
yeah I did that too. YNAB syncs with your bank so everything is automatic
okay you've convinced me, I'll try the free trial
nice! let me know if you have questions, happy to help
5K done! 28 minutes
nice!! I'm still in bed lol
same, but I'm going to the gym after work
that counts! consistency over intensity
speaking of which, has anyone tried that new yoga studio on 5th?
yes! went last week, really liked it. The hot yoga class was brutal though
brutal in a good way or bad way?
good! really challenging but I felt amazing after
maybe I should try yoga, running is getting boring
you should! it's great for recovery too
look at this face
[photo of a golden retriever]
MAX!!! what a good boy
oh my god those eyes, I'm melting
I miss having a dog so much
you should get one! best decision I ever made
my apartment doesn't allow pets unfortunately
that's the worst. my building technically doesn't either but everyone has them anyway
here's Luna being dramatic as usual
[photo of a cat lying on keyboard]
hahaha classic cat move
"you weren't using this right?"
remember that restaurant we went to for your birthday last year?
the Italian place? Lucia's?
yes! do you remember what that pasta dish was called? The one with the seafood
oh man that was so good. I think it was frutti di mare?
that's it! I've been craving it for weeks
we should go back soon, I'd kill for their tiramisu
Friday? I can make a reservation
perfect, I'm in!
just finished setting up my home office finally
oh nice! how did it turn out?
really happy with it. Got a standing desk converter and a proper ergonomic chair
standing desk is a game changer. which one did you get?
the Uplift V2. It wasn't cheap but the reviews were great
oh I've heard good things about that one. I have the Fully Jarvis
how long have you had it?
about 2 years now, still works perfectly. My back pain is basically gone
that's what I'm hoping for. I've been having so many issues from sitting all day
pro tip: get a good anti-fatigue mat for when you're standing. Makes a huge difference
ooh good call, adding that to my list
okay so Japan in October - who's actually in?
100% in, already started saving
same, I've wanted to go forever
I'm in too. Two weeks right?
yeah I was thinking Oct 10-24. That should cover Tokyo, Kyoto, maybe Osaka
can we add Hiroshima? I really want to see the peace memorial
definitely, it's a day trip from Osaka
what about accommodation? Hotels or Airbnb?
I vote mix - traditional ryokan for at least one night!
ooh yes, the ones with the hot springs
perfect. I'll start a shared doc for planning
this is going to be amazing
